source: USCIS Civics Test (2008, official study questions)

items.question: What is the supreme law of the land?
What does the Constitution do?
The idea of self-government is in the first three words of the Constitution. What are these words?
What is an amendment?
What do we call the first ten amendments to the Constitution?
What is one right or freedom from the First Amendment?
How many amendments does the Constitution have?
What did the Declaration of Independence do?
answers: Announced our independence from Great Britain
Said that the United States is free

items.question: What are two rights in the Declaration of Independence?
What is freedom of religion?
answers: You can practice any religion, or not practice a religion

items.question: What is the economic system in the United States?
What is the 'rule of law'?
answers: No one is above the law

items.question: Name one branch or part of the government.
What stops one branch of government from becoming too powerful?
Who is in charge of the executive branch?
Who makes federal laws?
What are the two parts of the U.S. Congress?
answers: The Senate and House of Representatives

items.question: How many U.S. Senators are there?
We elect a U.S. Senator for how many years?
Who is one of your state's U.S. Senators now?
The House of Representatives has how many voting members?
We elect a U.S. Representative for how many years?
Name your U.S. Representative.
Who does a U.S. Senator represent?
Why do some states have more Representatives than other states?
We elect a President for how many years?
In what month do we vote for President?
What is the name of the President of the United States now?
What is the name of the Vice President of the United States now?
If the President can no longer serve, who becomes President?
If both the President and the Vice President can no longer serve, who becomes President?
Who is the Commander in Chief of the military?
Who signs bills to become laws?
Who vetoes bills?
What does the President's Cabinet do?
What are two Cabinet-level positions?
What does the judicial branch do?
answers: Decides if a law goes against the Constitution

items.question: What is the highest court in the United States?
How many justices are on the Supreme Court?
Who is the Chief Justice of the United States now?
Under the Constitution, some powers belong to the federal government. What is one power of the federal government?
Under the Constitution, some powers belong to the states. What is one power of the states?
Who is the Governor of your state now?
What is the capital of your state?
What are the two major political parties in the United States?
What is the political party of the President now?
What is the name of the Speaker of the House of Representatives now?
There are four amendments to the Constitution about who can vote. Describe one of them.
answers: Citizens eighteen (18) and older can vote
You don’t have to pay a poll tax to vote
Any citizen can vote (women and men can vote)
A male citizen of any race can vote

items.question: What is one responsibility that is only for United States citizens?
Name one right only for United States citizens.
What are two rights of everyone living in the United States?
What do we show loyalty to when we say the Pledge of Allegiance?
What is one promise you make when you become a United States citizen?
answers: Give up loyalty to other countries
Defend the Constitution and laws of the United States
Obey the laws of the United States
Serve in the U.S. military (if needed)
Be loyal to the United States

items.question: How old do citizens have to be to vote for President?
What are two ways that Americans can participate in their democracy?
answers: Give an elected official your opinion
Support or oppose an issue or policy

items.question: When is the last day you can send in federal income tax forms?
When must all men register for the Selective Service?
What is one reason colonists came to America?
Who lived in America before the Europeans arrived?
What group of people was taken to America and sold as slaves?
Why did the colonists fight the British?
answers: Because of high taxes (taxation without representation)
Because the British army stayed in their houses (boarding, quartering)

items.question: Who wrote the Declaration of Independence?
When was the Declaration of Independence adopted?
There were 13 original states. Name three.
What happened at the Constitutional Convention?
answers: The Founding Fathers wrote the Constitution

items.question: When was the Constitution written?
The Federalist Papers supported the passage of the U.S. Constitution. Name one of the writers.
What is one thing Benjamin Franklin is famous for?
answers: Oldest member of the Constitutional Convention
First Postmaster General of the United States

items.question: Who is the “Father of Our Country”?
Who was the first President?
What territory did the United States buy from France in 1803?
Name one war fought by the United States in the 1800s.
Name the U.S. war between the North and the South.
Name one problem that led to the Civil War.
What was one important thing that Abraham Lincoln did?
answers: Led the United States during the Civil War

items.question: What did the Emancipation Proclamation do?
answers: Freed slaves in the Confederate states

items.question: What did Susan B. Anthony do?
Name one war fought by the United States in the 1900s.
Who was President during World War I?
Who was President during the Great Depression and World War II?
Name one war fought by the United States in the 2000s.
Who was President during the War in Afghanistan?
Who was President during the Iraq War?
What major event happened on September 11, 2001, in the United States?
Name one American Indian tribe in the United States.
Name one of the two longest rivers in the United States.
What ocean is on the West Coast of the United States?
What ocean is on the East Coast of the United States?
Name one U.S. territory.
Name one state that borders Canada.
Name one state that borders Mexico.
What is the capital of the United States?
Where is the Statue of Liberty?
Why does the flag have 13 stripes?
Why does the flag have 50 stars?
answers: Because there is one star for each state

items.question: What is the name of the national anthem?
When do we celebrate Independence Day?
Name two national U.S. holidays.
Where is the White House?
Who lives in the White House?
Why does the Constitution begin with 'We the People'?
answers: Because the government gets its power from the people

items.question: What is one responsibility of all Americans?
What are two rights of everyone living in the United States?
What does the judicial branch interpret?
Who appoints Supreme Court justices?
Who confirms Supreme Court justices?
What is the highest court in the land?
What is the main purpose of the Declaration of Independence?
answers: To declare independence from Great Britain

items.question: What is one goal of the Constitution?
answers: To provide for the common defense
To secure the blessings of liberty

items.question: What does the Bill of Rights protect?
What are the three branches of government?
Who represents the people in Congress?
Who represents all people of a state in Congress?
What does the President promise to do in the oath of office?
What is one power of Congress?
What is one power of the President?
What is one power of the Supreme Court?
What is the rule of law?
answers: No one is above the law

items.question: What is one right guaranteed by the First Amendment?
What does the Constitution do?
Why do Americans pay taxes?
What is the name of the current Governor of Florida?
Who are the two U.S. Senators from Florida?
What is the capital of Florida?
What is one responsibility that is only for U.S. citizens?
What are two ways citizens can participate in democracy?
When do we vote for President?
What is the name of the current President of the United States?
